conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs for objects A and B to determine displacement difference over time interval 0 to t1.
Both graphs show a curve starting from origin, rising to maximum velocity, then decreasing back to origin.
Displacement is the area under the velocity-time curve from 0 to t1.
Since both objects start from origin and move in same direction, displacement for both objects is same throughout time interval 0 to t1.
Since displacement is constant, difference in displacement between objects will not be continuously increasing; it will be zero at all times.
Conclude that difference in displacement between objects is not continuously increasing.
